July 30, 2020

Dear Solon Schools Families and Staff,

We were prepared to send you the school-specific communications tonight detailing the return to school to help you make your choice between in-person and virtual learning.

However, we have just received word that the Cuyahoga County Board of Health is recommending that all schools in our county start the school year remotely “due to the elevated risk posed to students, staff and family members.”

Clearly this directive will have an impact on our opening plans. Please bear with us as the district meets to assess our next steps. We will communicate more information with you tomorrow and early next week.

Science Saturday:
Science labs continue even with at-home remote learning for Solon students. This is “Let’s Burn Some Iron.”

For the lab, Solon High School chemistry teacher Tony Sanson burned steel wool (iron) to combine it with oxygen in the air. Using the mass before the reaction and then after, students were asked to determine the formula of the iron oxide that was formed. The lab is based on stoichiometry and empirical formulas.

It’s on to nationals for Solon High School Speech & Debate!

The Solon team took first place at the North Coast National Qualifier February 15, winning the O'Leary Excellence in Speech award.

Fifteen team members either qualified outright or as alternates to the National Speech & Debate Association National Tournament in Albuquerque, New Mexico, in June.

The following seven team members qualified for nationals: Madison Bolden, Nick Caraballo, Aditya Kalahasti, O'rimilo Oresanya, Megan Tang, Megan Wiser and Matthew Wilson.

Solon’s eight alternates to nationals are: Nandana Ahuja, Mira Atwah, Vaibhav Bhargava, Pinak Chitnis,
Aidan Cullers, Olivia Heus, Michelle Park and Seth Rendon.

“I am thrilled with the outcome of our national qualifier,” said Dan Ceci, Solon’s Speech & Debate advisor. “Our students this year are incredibly talented, but more importantly they are motivated, hardworking and great teammates. They truly care about one another and making our team as a whole better.”

It’s National School Counseling Week!

The Solon Schools are joining with districts nationwide this week in recognizing the impact school counselors can have in helping students achieve school success and plan for college or careers.

School counselors encourage students to examine their strengths, abilities, interests and talents; focus on positive ways to support students’ academic and social-emotional development; as well as help students set healthy, realistic and optimistic aspirations. Additionally, as an integral part of the educational team, school counselors work in partnership with families as they navigate the challenges of raising children in today’s world.
